item.title: Impulse Response Function Analysis: An Application to Macroeconomic Data of Pakistan
item.description: Impulse response function (IRF) is increasingly common in financial markets; it is significantly related to policy changes of Government or the firm. An IRF of any dynamic model is its reaction to some external fluctuations emerged with brief input signals over time. It is a way to examine and evaluate the impact of external shocks. To make a comprehensive view of Pakistan’s macroeconomy, six typical macroeconomic indicators focused for analysis. In this study the impact of one variable to all other variables with respect to external shocks has valued description with the help of VAR model.
